--- 
layout: post
title: Project Euler Problem 8
---
### Problem 
The problem involves a 1000-digit number, found [here](https://projecteuler.net/problem=8). 
> Find the thirteen adjacent digits in the 1000-digit number that have the greatest product. What is the value of this product?

### Solution 
The problem can be approached by 'reading' substrings in the 1000 digit number and multiplying the digits in the substring together to get
a product. The problem asks for a substring with length ```l = 13``` in the aforementioned 1000-digit number. 

Scala solution, reading through every 13-character substring and computing its product: 
```scala
// string S is the 1000 digit number
val S = ""
// taking a string of numbers, treating each digit as an individual digit, computer product
def digitProd(n: String): BigInt = {
  val g = n.map{_.asDigit}.toVector
  var C = 1
  var i1: BigInt = g(0)
  var i2: BigInt = 1 
  while (C < g.length){
    i2 = i1*g(C)
    C += 1 
    i1 = i2
    } 
  return i1
  }
// computes the products of substrings with a length l in a string
def substringProduct(s: String, l: Int): Vector[BigInt] = { 
  var I = 0 
  var J = l   
  val L = s.length
  var CAN: Vector[String] = Vector()    
  var sub: String = s.substring(I,J)    
  while (J < L) {
    sub = s.substring(I, J) 
    CAN = CAN++Vector(sub)
    I = I + 1
    J = J + 1
  }
  var products: Vector[BigInt] = Vector()
  for (i <- CAN) {
    var PR: BigInt = digitProd(i)
    products = products ++ Vector(PR)
  }
  return products
  }
// finding the set of all possible solutions in string S 
val solutionset = substringProduct(S,13)
val ans = solutionset.max
// ans = 23514624000
```
